Articles.Content:
So i install a bunch of mods and some times i have to remove one and it dosen't tell me witch mod errored.

and i suggest more bigger parts and more editor tools and a autopilot like mechjeb, tell me if you think its a bad idea.

So i install a bunch of mods and some times i have to remove one and it dosen't tell me witch mod errored.

You can't really suggest to SQUAD to create nice crash report for the mods! the modders have to do it themselves. SQUAD is not responsible for the mods.

and i suggest more bigger parts and more editor tools and a autopilot like mechjeb, tell me if you think its a bad idea.

All part of the what not to suggest list. So any discussion about those ones would bring the thread to be close.

Actually, generally speaking, the logs quite often reference exactly which mod is causing problems. It's quite rare that the troublemaking mod is not picked up by the crash log, in my experience. The one situation that pops to mind is the out-of-memory errors -- they won't give a specific mod, because it's a simple case of too many for the computer to handle.
Well vexx took me by speed. Crash reports usually tell you precisely what is going wrong if you know where to look.
